title: Arab OER Forum projects
segmentation: OK, good afternoon everyone.
Thank you Hector.
Thanks for everybody.
We will be talking about the Ovr experience in Arkansas University in Palestine and for a current initiative.
We are running with the our colleagues fellows in Jordan as well.
And this component will be mentioned by my colleague Maria.
Also, we have a an idea about.
How to disseminate the concept onto.
Broader level, including more countries, and this would integrate with the efforts for our Lebanese colleagues and our Egyptian colleagues as well.
Becausw and we hope that other.
Initiatives will come along and.
The main outcome that we do expect that having a very practical techniques to boost the efforts of the Arab Ovr Forum.
So here we go.
In our experience in the Open University in in Palestine.
There is a strategy of the University 404 boosting the openness of education, so the idea is for building defining a policies for the organization that boosts the openness.
The openness of access in the.
For students and for our communities, and we have a pretty excellent experience at the University.
In this aspect, the curriculums that developed by the University for the last 30 years have been circulated around the Arab world.

And we know this from the access to our portals we have ironias downloads that comes to our systems from Yemen, from Sudan from Egypt, from Libya we have some documents that would reach up to 25,000 downloads per document.
So we know that the use of our systems.
We can measure this through the external download.
That does not happen within our autonomous system and within the Palestinian network.
And this is fully compliant with our strategy.
The other strategy that we follow is to strengthen the Arabic content availability.

That's why we have always refused to integrate our systems with the social media systems currently, because this in a way or another, cause the Arabic content to migrate from the Arabic networks into social media networks.
And this is something that would affect the policy of trafficking the Arab Internet.
Coasting the traffic, coasting the content and the problem of the the oyar basically is based on the lack of business models in the Arab world that addresses content development.
Is not being developed within a business framework within a business model?
And that was one of the critiques for the panelists yesterday that I just did not like to contradict with the ones on the panel that.
The issue is.
The aspects that O ER addresses in the North Hamsphere.
Or in another world.
Are different from the issues that present in the southern world.
And it has to do with the with the knowledge, capitalization, copyrights, management, the monopoly of knowledge that we are is trying to.
Dissolve and to overcome for the South we don't have the knowledge capitalization.
We don't have intellectual property.
We don't have proper copy rights management.
What we need to do is to use as this is my advice for the South countries that use this momentum in this thrust.
For this knew systematic approach for building content and it working with the others.
It's time to.
Systemize the content development and try to accelerate.
On a country levels of building their own content.
Based on sharing becausw, no country on Earth can build its own educational content in a timely fashion.
Like we can build a very solid concrete educational system.
I like the argument of Sir John when he said that it's like a Misty Rd that I don't know where we are.
But if you would like to take this to it to its maximum levels.
How long would Lebanon require?
Or Egypt, for example, require to introduce an O ER dependant educational.
Content for elementary stage.
So if we put these questions on the agenda, we will just introduce how big is the issue, and it's not a problem and it's never late.
And the idea of networking that you can build on the progress of the others, and that's the best part about it.
The third strategy is promoting the 21st century skills for learners, and that's a key idea that E learning and E content is not a prestige.
We have in portal we have an E learning system.
We produce videos.
This is the thing that I keep on seeing from time to time.
The issue is we should keep in mind.
Two contradicting points.
Kualiti versus cost.
And course in its broadest concept, how can I?
Achieve the highest Clock quality on the lowest cost.
No, that's a contradicting thing and this is where creativity is required.
So the challenges that we faced, I really call on having a look on this timeline that how this this started in the open universities that.
The resources were CDs and then moved into digital content and then moved into digital content standardization and introducing the openness.
They Open Access and then the open licenses.
That's why we cannot call anything at this, and this is a claim has to be investigated in the Arab world that there is an O ER in their world.
Becausw ovr is not a content, it's a way of handling this content and we don't have a concrete.
Legal frameworks for handling any content.
So the idea is we should focus on how to share introduced technologies and make it more and more open to each others and to align our strategies based on this very effective content.
And we should never forget a very essential element which is the beneficiary.
The beneficiary in the first stage.
How do students see this?
Why are we doing this?
Because the student should answer.
The best question is because it is fun.
Can we achieve this that to make this process with some fun in it and it's very nice to do it?
That's how we can boost our content and this is what we're trying to introduce.
Actually, and this is the challenge that we are facing now that how can you make this process nice?
With the terms of its beneficiaries.
What we're doing currently is trying to introduce a framework, a complete framework that.
But how to orchestrate things together?
Knowledge content development pedagogy.
Instructional design.
The platform the technology, web, mobile, etc.
And we integrate this on the with the web televisions and we launched at the end the satellite channel that supports this concept.
Of open NIS.
It's important to see the how would you achieve in.
An organizational O ER it's very important to go into a standards.
Define your own standards.
Be compliant, don't invent things.
Reuse what exists.
Digital learning content.
How to turn everything into an Open Access platform.
This is how would you lead to?
I know we are what we have.
Currently we have 3300 Open Access digital learning resources and it's available on the D space.co.edu that can be.
That can be visited.
It's very important as well to have a digital content standard for the organization, because this is how you will integrate with the others.
This is how well you will reuse.
We converged into the the instructional and medical standards design and layout standards.
These you have to design as well, and the technical standards do not get stuck in the technical standards.
You need to focus on the pedagogy itself and it's very nice that go into the design and layouts standard.
I personally had to contract.
A Palestinian professor from Germany with a very strange.
Discipline which is he's in.
He is an expert of software beauty aspects and he graduated from Bremerhaven in Germany and yes, there is a discipline that's called like this that how you, why?
Apple looks beautiful.
More than Android there is answers for this and actually he had to design the interfaces of the software.
I couldn't convince anybody to contract him in the long term, but what does he do?
I said, well, let's give him a contract and see and he could make a difference.
So these kind of things you have to pay very good attention to people.
Look at very small details that you might never notice as an akademik, so it's good to listen to them.
We found out that Dublin core metadata standard for for for tagging information and of course the Creative Commons licenses.
You have to be into very high consideration.
You might take your content to your higher management and disk and re interpret the Creative Commons information.
They will bluntly tell you know.
My battery is low, not the computer.
Better is low, not mine.
OK.
So this is the Open Access platform that we are running currently.
We have a the digital content to represent a re.
We have our video platform which is called the cube.
We use the queue from Al Coots.
Word, which is the name of Jerusalem in Arabic, and we have the Q slide share and we have the QO in Google Play Store.
This is another component which is the mobile applications and would like to thank the Electro for awarding us the award for two years.
For Arabic language mobile applications.
And also we run this into our open educational resource and it's open and it's being used and exploited.
So this is our digital content repository should be exploited in our self learning open online courses.
There is the Q 2 which is in an open educational video sharing environment and social based platform.
It's a it's completely video sharing and it's an open source.
Technology was refactored by University teams.
And we have the Q.
This is how you invite people who actually works on producing content in the University.
And we have the IQ education satellite channel.
And we have the mobile learning applications we posted on Google Play and we have our own data store as well.
That was a crazy idea, but it works that you can download your applications from your own data store also.
We are working on integrating the content with with Apple.
It's very soon we will launch something.

So basically this is pretty much my advice to everybody is to focus on the educational component on the pedagogy on the instructional design on complying with standards of open educational resources because I know for sure that most of the organizations, maybe even in Europe do not have a content standard that they adapt.
You make content standard to protect yourself from forward risks.

And technology so that you're defining a standard will make you all of your work integrates together and integrates with the others and the translation of content standards will become the problem of someone else.
It will not be your problem because this will be a huge overhead.
Thank you very much.

To speak about the.
Our current projects.
